Description: Tapestry ornament (on single warp threads) of two clavi; Undyed, plain weave linen and purple wool; Clavi each joined to shoulder panel and two double sleeve bands and composed of oblongs with running animals and twisting vine stems; Panels have horseman within roundel framed by vines, dotted borders; Warp: wool, S spun, c.13 tpc; Weft: wool and linen, S spun, c.55-60 tpc; Edges: cut and trimed under, except down sides of panels.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, red box. Cut from another tunic, mainly of yellowy wool. Shoulder stripes are continuous with the panels. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (5.12.1989)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
